description: Number of "polyares" of order n (turning over allowed).
comments: An n-are is a shape formed from an n-celled polyominoe by removing half of each square cell in such a way that at least half of the original join between cells is retained.
references: Enumeration attributed by Andrew Clarke to Brendan Owen.
links: Picture from Andrew Clarke's page showing the 9 polyares of order 3 when turning over is allowed.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 29 2000
extensions: Link updated by _William Rex Marshall_, Dec 16 2009
